AcoustoOpticalBeamSplitter.description:
Extension=Advanced+Confocal
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Advanced
Description=An AOBS is actually an AOTF used in an imaginative manner by Leica to replace the dichroic mirror usually used to separate the illumination and the detection paths in a confocal fluorescence Microscope. In practice the AOBS is programmed so that it leaves most of the incoming beam of light undeflected, and it only deflects light originating from specific laser lines. The AOBS allows the simultaneous deflection of multiple laser lines simultaneously towards the sample, while at the same time controlling the intensity of each line independently.
Tier=1
Model_Settings=AcoustoOpticalBeamSplitterSettings
Extension=Advanced+Confocal
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Advanced
Description=An AOBS is actually an AOTF used in an imaginative manner by Leica to replace the dichroic mirror usually used to separate the illumination and the detection paths in a confocal fluorescence Microscope. The AOBS allows the simultaneous deflection of multiple laser lines simultaneously towards the sample, while at the same time controlling the intensity of each line independently.
Tier=1

AcoustoOpticalDeflector.description:
Extension=Advanced+Confocal
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Advanced
Description=Acousto-optic deflectors are devices which can be used to deflect a laser beam in one direction by a variable angle, controlled by the frequency of an electrical signal. Essentially, such a device is an acousto-optic modulator which is operated with an electrical drive signal of constant power but a variable frequency. The direction of the diffracted beam is determined by a Bragg condition, which contains the sound wavelength and thus depends on the sound frequency.
Tier=1
Model_Settings=AcoustoOpticalDeflectorSettings
Extension=Advanced+Confocal
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Advanced
Description=Acousto-optic deflectors are devices which can be used to deflect a laser beam in one direction by a variable angle, controlled by the frequency of an electrical signal. Essentially, such a device is an acousto-optic modulator which is operated with an electrical drive signal of constant power but a variable frequency. The direction of the diffracted beam is determined by a Bragg condition, which contains the sound wavelength and thus depends on the sound frequency.
Tier=1

AcoustoOpticalDevice.description:
Description=This is a device that performs spatial, temporal, and spectral modulations of light on the basis of acousto-optic (AO) diffraction. AO diffraction is a phenomenon whereby an acoustic wave propagating in an optically transparent medium, produces a periodic modulation of the index of refraction of the medium via the elasto-optical effect and might therefore diffract portions of an incident light into one or more directions.
Description=This is a device that performs spatial, temporal, and spectral modulations of light on the basis of acousto-optic (AO) diffraction. AO diffraction is a phenomenon whereby an acoustic wave propagating in an optically transparent medium, produces a periodic modulation of the index of refraction of the medium via the elasto-optical effect and might therefore diffract portions of an incident light into one or more directions.
AcoustoOpticalDevice.title: AcoustoOpticalDevice

AcoustoOpticalModulator.description:
Extension=Advanced+Confocal
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Advanced
Description=An acousto-optic modulator (AOM) is an electronically-tunable device which can be used for controlling the direction and/or intensity of a laser beam by an acoustically-induced diffraction grating in a crystal. It is based on the acousto-optic effect, i.e. the modification of the refractive index of some crystal or glass material by the oscillating mechanical strain of a sound wave (photoelastic effect).
Tier=1
Model_Settings=AcoustoOpticalModulatorSettings
Extension=Advanced+Confocal
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Advanced
Description=An acousto-optic modulator (AOM) is an electronically-tunable device which can be used for controlling the direction and/or intensity of a laser beam by an acoustically-induced diffraction grating in a crystal. It is based on the acousto-optic effect, i.e. the modification of the refractive index of some crystal or glass material by the oscillating mechanical strain of a sound wave (photoelastic effect).
Tier=1
Model_Settings=AcoustoOpticalModulatorSettings

attr_angleofincidence.description:
Description=This field records the optimal angle of incidence (AOI) for this Filter. The AOI is the angle between the optical axis of the incident light and the axis normal to the surface of the mirror. In specular reflection AOI is by definition equal to the Angle Of Reflection (AOR).
Tier=3

attr_angularaperture.description:
Description=This field records the angular aperture is the half-angle of the cone of light entering the this device. It is, therefore, a measure of how much of the incident light actually passes through the device.
Tier=3

attr_attenuationcoefficient.description:
Description=This field records the Attenuation Coefficient (AC) of this optical element. The AC (aka blocking coefficient) is a material property that characterizes the degree to which light is being blocked (i.e., scattered or absorbed) by it. AC is used as a measure of the out-of-band blocking of an optical Lens, Filter, Dichroic mirror over an extended range of the spectrum. AC is often reported in units of optical density (OD), whereas OD= -log10(T), and T=Transmittance (0≤T≤1).
Tier=3

attr_attenuationmethod.description:
Description=This field records the mean by which this optical element achieves out-of-band transmission attenuation.
Tier=2

attr_bragg.description:
Description=This indicates whether this device is operated under Bragg regime (True) or not. In Bragg regime, at one particular incidence angle , only one diffraction order is produced - the others are annihilated by destructive interference.
Tier=3

attr_catalognumber.description:
Description=This field records the Catalog, Part or Serial Number used by the Manufacturer to uniquely identify this component.
Tier=1

attr_coating.description:
Description=This field reports a description for any Coating that was layered on the Cover Glass, either by the Manufacturer or after purchase (e.g., Poly-L-Lysine, Collagen).
Tier=1

attr_contrastratio.description:
Description=This field records the reports on the ratio of maximum versus minimum transmittance.
Tier=2

attr_design.description:
Description=This field captures the design of the slit of this Hoffman Plate.
Tier=3

attr_geometry.description:
Description=This field records the geometrical shape of the surface(s) of this Mirror.
Tier=3

attr_lotnumber.description:
Description=The Lot Number used by the Manufacturer to refer to a specific production batch or lot for this component.
Tier=3

attr_manufacturer.description:
Description=This field refers to the company, research group or individual who built or manufactured this hardware component.
Tier=1

attr_material.description:
Description=This field describes the transparent crystal or glass material used to build this device, through which the light propagates and whose refractive properties can be modulated by acoustic waves of different frequencies.
Tier=3

attr_model.description:
Description=This field refers to the Model name or any other designation the Manufacturer uses for this component.
Tier=1

attr_operatingtemperature.description:
Description=This field represents the effective temperature the sensor was kept at during the Acquisition of this image.
Tier=3

attr_polarization.description:
Description=This field records the Polarization effect of this optical element. Any thin-film interference coating that is used at non-normal AOI will cause some amount of Polarization, the precise effect varying greatly with Wavelength and with the particular coating design.
Tier=3

attr_tuningaccuracy.description:
Description=This field measures the accuracy with which the wavelength discriminating capacity of this device can be tuned or changed.
Tier=3

attr_tuningrate.description:
Description=This field records the time it takes for this device to be tuned without degrading resolution. This time is determined by the velocity of the acoustic wage as it traverses the aperture of this device.
Tier=3

attr_tuningresolution.description:
Description=This field measures the wavelength discriminating capacity of this device and it is defined as the full width at half-maximum (FWHM) of the main lobe from the selected optical output, and is a function of both wavelength and device configuration.
Tier=3

attr_type.description: A human readable identifier for the screen type; e.g. RNAi, cDNA, SiRNA, etc. This string is likely to become an enumeration in future releases.

AcoustoOpticalModulator.title: AcoustoOpticalModulator

AcoustoOpticalTuneableFilter.description:
Extension=Advanced+Confocal
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Advanced
Description=This is kind tuneable filter, whose optical filtering properties can be tuned by virtue of acousto-optical deflection. As such, different wavelengths exits the crystal at different angles depending on the applied radio wave frequency. In an optical system in which the input light beam strikes the crystal at a specific angle and can only re-enter the system at a specific angle, then one can choose the wavelength of the light diffracted at the output angle angle by varying the frequency of the acoustic wave.
Tier=1

Description=This map defines any additional dimension beyond the canonical 5 dimensions XYZCT. It contains a number of elements for each Plane of data referring to this Additional Dimension.
Tier=2

attr_order.description:
Description=This field describes the order in which the individual Planes of data referring to this dimension are interleaved in the Image past the canonical 5 dimension XYZCT. The number should be zero based, e.g., 0, 1, 2 etc.
Tier=2

attr_presetstepincrement.description:
Description=This field records the preset size of Step Increment between Planes of data along this dimension. The Increment is numbered from 0, with default value of 1. Setting a value for this attribute to -1 indicates non-uniform sampling along this Additional Dimension. In this case the actual Step Increment value associated with each Plane along this Additional Dimension will have to be stored in TheIncrementStamp attribute of TheAdditionalDimension.
Tier=2

Description=This element is intendended to be used as a last-resort solution to capture vendor-specific Additional Information about this hardware component, which cannot be described using either available model elements (Classes or Attributes) or the Map Annotation feature of the schema. The use of this feature should not be intended as a way to hide information that the Imaging Community has designated as essential to ensure rigor and reproducibility. In case this feature is used, the Vendor is fully responsible for this information, including but not limited to, making sure this information is appropriately recorded and kept up to date.

attr_ambientoperatinghumidity.description:
Description=This field records the Ambient Humidity at which this detector is designed to operate, according to the Manufacturer.
Tier=3

attr_ambientoperatingtemperature.description:
Description=This field records the Ambient Temperature at which this Detector is designed to operate, according to the Manufacturer.
Tier=3

attr_arrayheight.description:
Description=This field records the Height of this Camera chip or sensor area, expressed in Pixel.
Tier=1

attr_arraywidth.description:
Description=This field records the Width of this Camera chip or sensor area, expressed in Pixel.
Tier=1

attr_catalognumber.description:
Description=This field records the Catalog, Part or Serial Number used by the Manufacturer to uniquely identify this component.
Tier=1

attr_color.description:
Description=This field records the Color used to render this Channel - encoded as RGBA. The default value is -1 corresponding #FFFFFFFF, so solid white (it is a signed 32 bit value).
Tier=1

attr_darkcurrentrate.description:
Description=This field records the Dark Current Rate of this Detector as specified by the Manufacturer. The Dark Current Rate is the median current detected in the absence of light. Generally expressed in e-/Pixel/sec.
Tier=2

attr_detectornoisemodel.description:
Description=This field records the Noise Model associated with this Detector.
Tier=2

attr_dynamicrange.description:
Description=This field records the Dynamic Range of this Detector in deciBel (dB).
Tier=2

attr_electronicconversionfactor.description:
Description=This field records the Electron-Conversion Factor for this Detector, as specified by the Manufacturer. The Electron Conversion Factor relates the actual number of electrons generated by the Detector with the digital number associated with each Pixel. It is expressed in electrons/Analog-to-Digital-Unit (ADU). Note that ADU can also be referred to as Digital Number (DN) or Binary Number. It is sometimes referred to as Digital Gain or, in case of CCD cameras as CCD Gain.
Tier=2

attr_illumination.description:
Description=This field records the type of illumination the Camera chip receives.
Tier=2

attr_lotnumber.description:
Description=The Lot Number used by the Manufacturer to refer to a specific production batch or lot for this component.
Tier=3

attr_manufacturer.description:
Description=This field refers to the company, research group or individual who built or manufactured this hardware component.
Tier=1

attr_manufactureroffet.description:
Description=This field reports the Camera Offset when it is pre-set by the Manufacturer. The Offset is an electronic baseline added to the output signal from the sensor to ensure that the displayed signal level is always a positive number of counts.
Tier=2

attr_maxbitdepth.description:
Description=This field records the Maximum Bit Depth provided by the Detector's Analog to Digital Converter (ADC; also referred to as Digitizer).
Tier=2

attr_maximumframerate.description:
Description=This field records the maximal rate at which this Camera can acquire a single full-frame.
Tier=3

attr_maximumreadoutrate.description:
Description=This field records the maximal Pixel Readout Rate allowed by this Camera.
Tier=3

attr_model.description:
Description=This field refers to the Model name or any other designation the Manufacturer uses for this component.
Tier=1

attr_mount.description:
Description=This field records the type of Mount used to connect this detector to the Microscope Stand.
Tier=1

attr_pixelheight.description:
Description=This field records the Physical Height of each Camera Pixel.
Tier=1

attr_pixelwellcapacity.description:
Description=This field records the maximum amount of charge each Pixel Well can hold, measured in electron counts.
Tier=3

attr_pixelwidth.description:
Description=This field records the Physical Width of each Camera Pixel.
Tier=1

attr_quantumefficiency.description:
Description=This field records the Quantum Efficiency observed at Peak Wavelength, according to the Manufacturer. Quantum Efficiency is generally defined as is the ratio of incident photons to converted electrons. Typically expressed as a number between 0 and 1.
Tier=2

attr_readoutnoise.description:
Description=This field captures the Read-out Noise associated with this Detector, as specified by the Manufacturer. Read-out Noise is a constant amount of noise and it includes thermal noise build-up and clock induced charge added by the CCD chip, the readout amplifier and surrounding electronics. It is generally expressed in photo-electrons (i.e., e- root-mean-square).
Tier=2

attr_verticalclockspeed.description:
Description=This field records the maximal speed at which each vertical column of pixels in the camera chip can be shifted down and read.
Tier=3

Arc.description:
Extension=Core
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=LightSource
Description=An Arc lamp is a discharge lamp that produces light by an electric arc (also called a voltaic arc), which is typically generated between metal electrodes and travels through an inert gas in a glass bulb. The inert gas can be Mercury (He), Xenon (Xe), or a mixture of the two. The choice of the gas is important because its nature determines the spectral behavior of the lamp. Refer to Type for more informations about this aspect.
Tier=1
Split=[Fluorescence_LightSource]
Model_Settings=LightSourceSettings

BeamCollimator.description:
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=OpticalAssembly
Description=Beam Collimators are Lens Systems that transform a strongly diverging light beam into a collimated beam, i.e., a beam where light propagates essentially only in one direction, and the beam divergence is weak. Beam Collimators typically contain some kind of Focusing Lens, or sometimes a curved Mirror, and usually some opto-mechanics for stable mounting and possibly adjustment. Beam Expanders can be custom built or they are also available as pre-assembled optical devices.
Tier=2
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=OpticalAssembly

Beam Expanders can be custom built or they are also available as pre-assembled optical devices.
Tier=2

BeamCollimatorLens.description:
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Lens
Description=A Beam Collimator Lens is a Lens designed to work in combination with other optical components to form a Beam Collimator device. As such, its role is to transform a strongly diverging light beam into a collimated beam, i.e., a beam where light propagates mainly only in one direction, and the beam divergence is weak.
Tier=2
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Lens
Description=A Beam Collimator Lens is a Lens designed to work in combination with other optical components to form a Beam Collimator device. As such, its role is to transform a strongly diverging light beam into a collimated beam, i.e., a beam where light propagates mainly only in one direction, and the beam divergence is weak.
Tier=2

attr_abbenumber.description:
Description=This field records the Abbe number of this Lens. The Abbe Number is a measure of the material's dispersion (variation of Refractive Index versus Wavelength), with high values indicating low dispersion.
Tier=3

attr_attenuationcoefficient.description:
Description=This field records the Attenuation Coefficient (AC) of this optical element. The AC (aka blocking coefficient) is a material property that characterizes the degree to which light is being blocked (i.e., scattered or absorbed) by it. AC is used as a measure of the out-of-band blocking of an optical Lens, Filter, Dichroic mirror over an extended range of the spectrum. AC is often reported in units of optical density (OD), whereas OD= -log10(T), and T=Transmittance (0≤T≤1).
Tier=3

attr_backfocallength.description:
Description=This field records the distance (f') measured along the optical axis from the rear principal Plane of this Lens to the rear focal Plane (F').
Tier=3

attr_catalognumber.description:
Description=This field records the Catalog, Part or Serial Number used by the Manufacturer to uniquely identify this component.
Tier=1

attr_coating.description:
Description=This field reports a description for any Coating that was layered on the Cover Glass, either by the Manufacturer or after purchase (e.g., Poly-L-Lysine, Collagen).
Tier=1

attr_composite.description:
Description=This field records whether this Lens is Composite (i.e., composed of multiple Lenses; True) or Simple (False).
Tier=3

attr_density.description:
Description=This field records the Density of the material this Lens is made of.
Tier=3

attr_diameter.description:
Description=This field describes the Diameter of this optical element.
Tier=3

attr_frontfocallength.description:
Description=This field records the distance (f) measured along the optical axis from the front principal Plane of this Lens to the front focal Plane (F).
Tier=3

attr_geometry.description:
Description=This field records the geometrical shape of the surface(s) of this Mirror.
Tier=3

attr_glasscode.description:
Description=If available, this field records the international Glass Code of the material that constitutes this Mirror. The Glass Code designation is based on U.S. military standard MIL-G-174, and it consists of a six-digit number specifying the glass according to its Refractive Index nd at the Fraunhofer d- (or D3-) line, and its Abbe Number Vd also taken at that line. The resulting Glass Code is the value of nd-1 rounded to three digits, followed by Vd rounded to three digits, with all decimal points ignored. For example, BK7 has nd = 1.5168 and Vd = 64.17, giving a six-digit Glass Code of 517642.
Tier=3

attr_imagedistance.description:
Description=This field records the distance in air between the rear principal Plane of this Objective and the primary Image Plane.
Tier=3

attr_infinity.description:
Description=This field records whether (True) or not (False) this Lens is infinity corrected. An Infinity-corrected Lens is fixed for an infinite sample to primary Image distance. It needs to be used with a Tube Lens of appropriate focal length to obtain the specified magnification.
Tier=2

attr_lensna.description:
Description=This field captures the nominal Numerical Aperture (NA) of this Objective as specified by the Manufactuer, expressed as a floating-point (real) number (e.g. 1.27 NA). NA is a number that was defined initially by Abbe to characterize Objectives and Condensers. NA can be calculated by the expression n sin alpha, where n is the Refractive Index of the medium between the Lens and the Sample, and alpha is half the Angular Aperture of the Lens. NA is a measure of how much of the illumination that leaves the specimen actually passes through the Lens. The larger the NA, the more information the lens can transmit. Expected range 0.02 - 1.5.
Tier=1

attr_lotnumber.description:
Description=The Lot Number used by the Manufacturer to refer to a specific production batch or lot for this component.
Tier=3

attr_magnification.description:
Description=This field captures the Magnification of the Objective as specified by the Manufacturer - i.e., 60 represents a 60X lens.
Tier=1

attr_manufacturer.description:
Description=This field refers to the company, research group or individual who built or manufactured this hardware component.
Tier=1

attr_materialname.description:
Description=This field records the chemical composition or the non-proprietary trade designation of the material used to construct this Light Guide.
Tier=3

attr_model.description:
Description=This field refers to the Model name or any other designation the Manufacturer uses for this component.
Tier=1

attr_radiusofcurvature.description:
Description=The radius of curvature of this Mirror. A spherical lens or Mirror surface has a center of curvature located either along or decentered from the system local optical axis. The vertex of the lens surface is located on the local optical axis. The distance from the vertex to the center of curvature is the radius of curvature of the surface.
Tier=3

attr_refractiveindex.description:
Description=This field reocrds the nominal Refractive Index of this Immersion Liquid, as specified by the Manufacturer.
Tier=2

attr_shape.description:
Description=This field captures the Shape of the aperture of this Iris Diaphragm.
Tier=3

attr_workingdistance.description:
Description=This field reports the Working Distance of this Objective under normal operating conditions. The Working Distance is the distance (in air, or in the specified immersion liquid) between the front of an Objective and the surface of the cover glass or of the specimen if uncovered.
Tier=2

BeamCollimatorLens.title: BeamCollimatorLens

BeamExpander.description:
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=OpticalAssembly
Description=Beam Expanders are Lens Systems whose role is to increase the diameter of a collimated input beam to a larger collimated output beam. Beam Expanders typically are afocal systems in which object rays enter and exit parallel to the optical axis. As such a Beam Expander does not have a focal length. In most cases, Beam Expanders are realized as optical telescopes consisting of two lenses. Beam Expanders can be custom built or they are also available as pre-assembled optical devices.
Tier=2
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=OpticalAssembly
Description=Beam Expanders are Lens Systems whose role is to increase the diameter of a collimated input beam to a larger collimated output beam. Beam Expanders typically are afocal systems in which object rays enter and exit parallel to the optical axis. As such a Beam Expander does not have a focal length. In most cases, Beam Expanders are realized as optical telescopes consisting of two lenses. Beam Expanders can be custom built or they are also available as pre-assembled optical devices.
Tier=2

Tier=1

attr_configuration.description:

Tier=3

attr_lotnumber.description:

Tier=3

Tier=1

Tier=1

BeamExpander.title: BeamExpander

BeamExpanderLens.description:
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Lens
Description=A Beam Expander Lens is a Lens designed to work in combination with other optical components to form a Beam Expander device. As such, its role is to increase the diameter of a collimated input beam to a larger collimated output beam.
Tier=2
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Lens
Description=A Beam Expander Lens is a Lens designed to work in combination with other optical components to form a Beam Expander device. As such, its role is to increase the diameter of a collimated input beam to a larger collimated output beam.
Tier=2

attr_abbenumber.description:
Description=This field records the Abbe number of this Lens. The Abbe Number is a measure of the material's dispersion (variation of Refractive Index versus Wavelength), with high values indicating low dispersion.
Tier=3

attr_attenuationcoefficient.description:
Description=This field records the Attenuation Coefficient (AC) of this optical element. The AC (aka blocking coefficient) is a material property that characterizes the degree to which light is being blocked (i.e., scattered or absorbed) by it. AC is used as a measure of the out-of-band blocking of an optical Lens, Filter, Dichroic mirror over an extended range of the spectrum. AC is often reported in units of optical density (OD), whereas OD= -log10(T), and T=Transmittance (0≤T≤1).
Tier=3

attr_backfocallength.description:
Description=This field records the distance (f') measured along the optical axis from the rear principal Plane of this Lens to the rear focal Plane (F').
Tier=3

attr_catalognumber.description:
Description=This field records the Catalog, Part or Serial Number used by the Manufacturer to uniquely identify this component.
Tier=1

attr_coating.description:
Description=This field reports a description for any Coating that was layered on the Cover Glass, either by the Manufacturer or after purchase (e.g., Poly-L-Lysine, Collagen).
Tier=1

attr_composite.description:
Description=This field records whether this Lens is Composite (i.e., composed of multiple Lenses; True) or Simple (False).
Tier=3

attr_density.description:
Description=This field records the Density of the material this Lens is made of.
Tier=3

attr_diameter.description:
Description=This field describes the Diameter of this optical element.
Tier=3

attr_frontfocallength.description:
Description=This field records the distance (f) measured along the optical axis from the front principal Plane of this Lens to the front focal Plane (F).
Tier=3

attr_geometry.description:
Description=This field records the geometrical shape of the surface(s) of this Mirror.
Tier=3

attr_glasscode.description:
Description=If available, this field records the international Glass Code of the material that constitutes this Mirror. The Glass Code designation is based on U.S. military standard MIL-G-174, and it consists of a six-digit number specifying the glass according to its Refractive Index nd at the Fraunhofer d- (or D3-) line, and its Abbe Number Vd also taken at that line. BeamSplitter.description:
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=MirroringDevice
Description=This element describes a Mirror that reflects part of the light, regardless of wavelength.
Tier=2
Model_Settings=MirroringDeviceSettings
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=MirroringDevice
Description=This element describes a Mirror that reflects part of the light, regardless of wavelength.
Tier=2
Model_Settings=MirroringDeviceSettings

attr_angleofincidence.description:
Description=This field records the optimal angle of incidence (AOI) for this Filter. The AOI is the angle between the optical axis of the incident light and the axis normal to the surface of the mirror. In specular reflection AOI is by definition equal to the Angle Of Reflection (AOR).
Tier=3

attr_catalognumber.description:
Description=This field records the Catalog, Part or Serial Number used by the Manufacturer to uniquely identify this component.
Tier=1

attr_diameter.description:
Description=This field describes the Diameter of this optical element.
Tier=3

attr_geometry.description:
Description=This field records the geometrical shape of the surface(s) of this Mirror.
Tier=3

attr_glasscode.description:
Description=If available, this field records the international Glass Code of the material that constitutes this Mirror. The Glass Code designation is based on U.S. military standard MIL-G-174, and it consists of a six-digit number specifying the glass according to its Refractive Index nd at the Fraunhofer d- (or D3-) line, and its Abbe Number Vd also taken at that line. The resulting Glass Code is the value of nd-1 rounded to three digits, followed by Vd rounded to three digits, with all decimal points ignored. For example, BK7 has nd = 1.5168 and Vd = 64.17, giving a six-digit Glass Code of 517642.

Tier=3

attr_manufacturer.description:
Description=This field refers to the company, research group or individual who built or manufactured this hardware component.
Tier=1

attr_mirrortype.description:
Description=This field records the general category of this Mirror.
Tier=3

attr_model.description:
Description=This field refers to the Model name or any other designation the Manufacturer uses for this component.
Tier=1

attr_opticsholderposition.description:
Description=This field records the position of this Mirroring Device in a Optics Holder of any kind, such as a Slider, Turret or Wheel.
Tier=2

attr_radiusofcurvature.description:
Description=The radius of curvature of this Mirror. A spherical lens or Mirror surface has a center of curvature located either along or decentered from the system local optical axis. The vertex of the lens surface is located on the local optical axis. The distance from the vertex to the center of curvature is the radius of curvature of the surface.
Tier=3

attr_reflectance.description:
Description=The field records the maximum amount of light this Beamsplitteris capable of reflecting at the peak Wavelength. It is represented as a fractional value from 0.0 to 1.0.
Tier=2

attr_substratematerial.description:
Description=This field records the chemical composition or the designation of the substrate of this Mirroring Device. The substrate is typically composed of a glass material with low autofluorescence, such as UV-grade fused silica or Borofloat.
Tier=3

attr_substratetype.description:
Description=This field records the type of Substrate that is used for this Mirror. It is typically a ground and polished piece of optical glass.
Tier=3

attr_transmissionangle.description:
Description=The angle at which light is transmitted by this Beamsplitter.
Tier=3

attr_transmittance.description:
Description=The maximum amount of light this Light Source Coupling device is capable of transmitting at the Peak Wavelength. It is represented as a fractional value from 0.0 to 1.0.
Tier=3

attr_transmittanceprofilefile.description:
Description=This field records the location of a file in .csv or other suitable formats containing the Transmittance profile of this optical component.
Tier=3

BeamSplitter.title: BeamSplitter

BinData.description:
Extension=Core
Domain=ImageAcquistionSettings
Category=Data
Description=The contents of this element are base64-encoded. These are not CDATA sections, just a base64 stream.
Tier=1
Extension=Core
Domain=ImageAcquistionSettings
Category=Data
Description=The contents of this element are base64-encoded. These are not CDATA sections, just a base64 stream.
Tier=1

attr_bigendian.description:
Description=This field is True if the pixels data was written in BigEndian order. If this value is present, it should match the value used in BinData or TiffData. If it is not, a reader should be used that honors the value used in the BinData or TiffData. This value is useful for MetadataOnly files and is to allow for future storage solutions.
Tier=3

attr_compression.description: Specifies the compression scheme used to encode the data.

attr_length.description: Character count attribute for the BinData field. This is the length of the base-64 encoded block. It allows easy skipping of the block when parsing the file. [unit:bytes]

BinData.title: BinData

BinaryFile.description:
Describes a binary file.
Describes a binary file.
BinaryFile.title: BinaryFile

BooleanAnnotation.description:
A simple boolean annotation of type xsd:boolean.
A simple boolean annotation of type xsd:boolean.

attr_annotator.description:
Description=The Annotator is the person who attached this annotation.e.g. If UserA annotates something with TagB, owned by UserB, UserA is still the Annotator.
Tier=3

attr_namespace.description:
Description=We recommend the inclusion of a namespace for annotations you define. If it is absent then we assume the annotation is to use our (OME's) default interpretation for this type.
Tier=3

BooleanAnnotation.title: BooleanAnnotation

CCD.description:
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Detector.Camera
Description=This element represents a Charged Coupled Device Camera.
Tier=1
Model_Settings=CameraSettings
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Detector.Camera
Description=This element represents a Charged Coupled Device Camera.
Tier=1
Model_Settings=CameraSettings

attr_ambientoperatinghumidity.description:
Description=This field records the Ambient Humidity at which this detector is designed to operate, according to the Manufacturer.
Tier=3

attr_ambientoperatingtemperature.description:
Description=This field records the Ambient Temperature at which this Detector is designed to operate, according to the Manufacturer.
Tier=3

attr_arrayheight.description:
Description=This field records the Height of this Camera chip or sensor area, expressed in Pixel.
Tier=1

attr_arraywidth.description:
Description=This field records the Width of this Camera chip or sensor area, expressed in Pixel.
Tier=1

attr_catalognumber.description:
Description=This field records the Catalog, Part or Serial Number used by the Manufacturer to uniquely identify this component.
Tier=1

attr_ccdarchitecture.description:
Description=This field captures the Architecture of this CCD Camera and its associated Transfer Mode.
Tier=2

attr_color.description:
Description=This field records the Color used to render this Channel - encoded as RGBA. The default value is -1 corresponding #FFFFFFFF, so solid white (it is a signed 32 bit value).
Tier=1

attr_darkcurrentrate.description:
Description=This field records the Dark Current Rate of this Detector as specified by the Manufacturer. The Dark Current Rate is the median current detected in the absence of light. Generally expressed in e-/Pixel/sec.
Tier=2

attr_detectornoisemodel.description:
Description=This field records the Noise Model associated with this Detector.
Tier=2

attr_dynamicrange.description:
Description=This field records the Dynamic Range of this Detector in deciBel (dB).
Tier=2

attr_electronicconversionfactor.description:
Description=This field records the Electron-Conversion Factor for this Detector, as specified by the Manufacturer. The Electron Conversion Factor relates the actual number of electrons generated by the Detector with the digital number associated with each Pixel. It is expressed in electrons/Analog-to-Digital-Unit (ADU). Note that ADU can also be referred to as Digital Number (DN) or Binary Number. It is sometimes referred to as Digital Gain or, in case of CCD cameras as CCD Gain.
Tier=2

attr_illumination.description:
Description=This field records the type of illumination the Camera chip receives.
Tier=2

attr_lotnumber.description:
Description=The Lot Number used by the Manufacturer to refer to a specific production batch or lot for this component.
Tier=3

attr_manufacturer.description:
Description=This field refers to the company, research group or individual who built or manufactured this hardware component.
Tier=1

attr_manufactureroffet.description:
Description=This field reports the Camera Offset when it is pre-set by the Manufacturer. The Offset is an electronic baseline added to the output signal from the sensor to ensure that the displayed signal level is always a positive number of counts.
Tier=2

attr_maxbitdepth.description:
Description=This field records the Maximum Bit Depth provided by the Detector's Analog to Digital Converter (ADC; also referred to as Digitizer).
Tier=2

attr_maximumframerate.description:
Description=This field records the maximal rate at which this Camera can acquire a single full-frame.
Tier=3

attr_maximumreadoutrate.description:
Description=This field records the maximal Pixel Readout Rate allowed by this Camera.
Tier=3

attr_model.description:
Description=This field refers to the Model name or any other designation the Manufacturer uses for this component.
Tier=1

attr_mount.description:
Description=This field records the type of Mount used to connect this detector to the Microscope Stand.
Tier=1

attr_pixelheight.description:
Description=This field records the Physical Height of each Camera Pixel.
Tier=1

attr_pixelwellcapacity.description:
Description=This field records the maximum amount of charge each Pixel Well can hold, measured in electron counts.
Tier=3

attr_pixelwidth.description:
Description=This field records the Physical Width of each Camera Pixel.
Tier=1

attr_quantumefficiency.description:
Description=This field records the Quantum Efficiency observed at Peak Wavelength, according to the Manufacturer. Quantum Efficiency is generally defined as is the ratio of incident photons to converted electrons. Typically expressed as a number between 0 and 1.
Tier=2

attr_readoutnoise.description:
Description=This field captures the Read-out Noise associated with this Detector, as specified by the Manufacturer. Read-out Noise is a constant amount of noise and it includes thermal noise build-up and clock induced charge added by the CCD chip, the readout amplifier and surrounding electronics. It is generally expressed in photo-electrons (i.e., e- root-mean-square).
Tier=2

attr_registerwellcapacity.description:
Description=This field records the maximum amount of charge each read-out register well can hold, measured in electron counts.
Tier=3

attr_type.description: A human readable identifier for the screen type; e.g. RNAi, cDNA, SiRNA, etc. This string is likely to become an enumeration in future releases.

attr_verticalclockspeed.description:
Description=This field records the maximal speed at which each vertical column of pixels in the camera chip can be shifted down and read.
Tier=3

CCD.title: CCD

CalibrationMap.description:
Extension=Calibration and Performance
Domain=ImageAcquisitionSettings
Category=CalibrationProcedure
Description=This element describes a 2D matrix containing values computed as a resulut of the calibration procedure. This matrix is the same size of the experimental Image this calibration refers to.
Tier=3
Extension=Calibration and Performance
Domain=ImageAcquisitionSettings
Category=CalibrationProcedure
Description=This element describes a 2D matrix containing values computed as a resulut of the calibration procedure. This matrix is the same size of the experimental Image this calibration refers to.
Tier=3

attr_illuminationintensity.description:
Description=This attribute only applies to matrices of type Variance and Mean. It represents the illumination intensity that was used to acquire the images used to contruct this matrix. The value can range from 0 (i.e. dark image) to any intenisty value experssed either as percentage or as absolute power.
Tier=2

attr_metrictype.description:
Description=This field captures the type of metric that was computed as part of the calibratin procedure in this instance.
Tier=2

attr_nrofimages.description:
Description=This field represents the number of images that were employed to generate this calibration matrix.
Tier=2

CalibrationMap.title: CalibrationMap

CalibrationSoftware.description:
Extension=Calibration and Performance
Domain=ImageAcquisitionSettings
Category=Software
Description=This element describes a software tool utilized to analyze Calibration metrics obtained from this Calibration Procedure and generate a suitable Calibration Reports. As an example, such a Software tool might analyzes microscopy images of fluorescent Colored Beads in order to quantify the Resolution and Chromatic Registration of a fluorescence microsocope over the full Field of View (FOV). An example of such a tool is PSFj (http://www.knoplab.de/psfj/sample-page/). Alternatively, such a Software tool might be used to extract Intensity Calibration results obtained with a specific Intensity Calibration Tool, such as a Power Meter or MetaMax (https://www.umassmed.edu/grunwaldlab/).
Tier=2
Extension=Calibration and Performance
Domain=ImageAcquisitionSettings
Category=Software
Description=This element describes a software tool utilized to analyze Calibration metrics obtained from this Calibration Procedure and generate a suitable Calibration Reports. As an example, such a Software tool might analyzes microscopy images of fluorescent Colored Beads in order to quantify the Resolution and Chromatic Registration of a fluorescence microsocope over the full Field of View (FOV). An example of such a tool is PSFj (http://www.knoplab.de/psfj/sample-page/). Alternatively, such a Software tool might be used to extract Intensity Calibration results obtained with a specific Intensity Calibration Tool, such as a Power Meter or MetaMax (https://www.umassmed.edu/grunwaldlab/).
Tier=2
CalibrationSoftware.title: CalibrationSoftware

CalibrationStandardSlide.description:
Extension=Calibration and Performance
Domain=ImageAcquisitionSettings
Category=CalibrationSample
Description=This element describes a Standard Calibration Slide (also referred to as Standard Test Slide) used for assessing the Optical properties of the Microscope that was used to acquire this experimental Image. These Slides can be used to measure multiple different Optical properties including resolution, chromatic registration, magnification, distance, and different kinds of optical distorsions.
Tier=2
Extension=Calibration and Performance
Domain=ImageAcquisitionSettings
Category=CalibrationSample
Description=This element describes a Standard Calibration Slide (also referred to as Standard Test Slide) used for assessing the Optical properties of the Microscope that was used to acquire this experimental Image. These Slides can be used to measure multiple different Optical properties including resolution, chromatic registration, magnification, distance, and different kinds of optical distorsions.
Tier=2

attr_calibrationmeasure.description:
Description=This field captures the Optical characteristic this Slide is intended to calibrate, examples include Co-registration Accuracy, Detector linearity, Distance, Magnification, Optical distorsion, Resolution, or Multi.
Tier=2

attr_catalognumber.description:
Description=This field records the Catalog, Part or Serial Number used by the Manufacturer to uniquely identify this component.
Tier=1

attr_imagedarea.description:
Description=This field describes the specific region or sets or regions of the Calibration Slide that have been used for this Optical Calibration procedure.
Tier=2

attr_lotnumber.description:
Description=The Lot Number used by the Manufacturer to refer to a specific production batch or lot for this component.
Tier=3

attr_manufacturer.description:
Description=This field refers to the company, research group or individual who built or manufactured this hardware component.
Tier=1

attr_method.description:
Description=This field captures the approach used by this TIRF Hardware Module to produce TIRF illumination. In Objective-based TIRF, the excitation lightpath and the emission channel share the same optics, which provides high signals but might result in high background. In Prism-based TIRF excitation light enters the dovetail prism, reflects at the glass/water interface and escapes through the opposite facet without interferring with the emission channel . In Lightguide-based TIRF, excitation light enters the lightguide, reflects multiple times from its top and bottom surfaces to generate wide-area evanescent waves and escapes from the opposite side of the lightguide without interferring with the emission channel.
Tier=1

attr_model.description:
Description=This field refers to the Model name or any other designation the Manufacturer uses for this component.
Tier=1

Camera.description:
Description=This element describes a Camera available for this Instrument. A Camera is a device that converts optical brightness into an electrical signal using a grid of pixel sensor unit cells and then reproduces an image of the specimen. An Instrument may have more than one camera of different types, such as traditional CCD, EMCCD, Intensified EMCCD, sCMOS, or Analog Video.
Description=This element describes a Camera available for this Instrument. A Camera is a device that converts optical brightness into an electrical signal using a grid of pixel sensor unit cells and then reproduces an image of the specimen. An Instrument may have more than one camera of different types, such as traditional CCD, EMCCD, Intensified EMCCD, sCMOS, or Analog Video.
Camera.title: Camera

CameraSettings.description:
Extension=Basic
Domain=ImageAcquisitionSettings
Category=Settings
Description=This element refers to the Camera used to acquire this Channel and it holds the Settings that were applied to the Camera during this Acquisition.
Tier=1
Extension=Basic
Domain=ImageAcquisitionSettings
Category=Settings
Description=This element refers to the Camera used to acquire this Channel and it holds the Settings that were applied to the Camera during this Acquisition.
Tier=1

attr_amplificationgain.description:
Description=This field reports the Amplification Gain (i.e., electronic gain as apposed to the inherent Gain) that was set during the Acquisition of this Image. Amplification Gain in general measures of the ability of a Detector to add energy to the input light signal therefore increasing its power or amplitude. Higher Amplification Gain levels amplify the signal and result in greater brightness, contrast and background signal. Examples include: 1) the Electron Multiplication (EM) gain (as opposed to the inherent Analog Gain) for an EMCCD camera. 2) The Gain introduced by the Micro-Channel Plate in an Intensified CCD or CMOS camera. 3) The amplification of the electron current provided by a Photomultiplier Tube, and measured as the ratio of the input photoelectron current emitted by the photocatode and the current reaching the anode. 4) The signal amplification provided by an Avalache Photo Diode (APD).
Tier=1

attr_analoggain.description:
Description=This field reports the Analog Gain (also known as Inherent Gain or simply as Gain) that was applied during the Acquisition of this Image. The Analog Gain is a property Inherent to the Detector and it specifies how many electrons correspond to 1 signal unit (photon) detected. Gain is reported in terms of electrons/ADU (analog-to-digital unit). A gain of 8 means that the Detector digitizes the light signal so that each ADU corresponds to 8 photoelectrons. NOTE: In the case of Point Detectors the value of Analog Gain can be set freely by the user. Conversely, in the case of Cameras, it is common for the Gain to be preset by the Manufacturer to minimize noise. In this case, either the Analog Gain cannot be changed or the user is given the choice of selecting between a few preset Analog Gains values upon Acquisition. Finally, several Cameras might have so-called Automatic Gain Control (AGC or AutoGain) that will automatically adjusts so the full range of the Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) is used. Unless you can turn off the AGC, the use of these Cameras are highly discouraged for quantitative work.
Tier=1

attr_binning.description:
Description=This field represents the number of adjacent pixels whose electric charge is combined in the resulting Image (e.g. binning = 2x2). Generally, binning increases read-out rates, signal-to-noise ratio, and relative sensitivity, while it reduces the spatial resolution.
Tier=1

attr_effectivebitdepth.description:
Description=If selectable, this field reports the Effective Bit Depth that was used by the Detector's Analog to Digital Converter (ADC; also referred to as Digitizer) for the Acquisition of this Channel.
Tier=1

attr_framerate.description:
Description=Frame Rate is the inverse of the time needed for the CCD to acquire a single Frame (or Plane) and then completely read that image out. Frame Rate is typically expressed in frames per second (fps). Often, the Frame Rate can be approximately calculated from the total number of pixels and the readout rate, combined with the total exposure time. This field represents the effective Frame Rate used for the Acquisition of this Image.
Tier=3

attr_integration.description:
Description=This field represents the number of sequential frames that have been averaged to obtain this image, to improve the overall signal-to-noise ratio.
Tier=2

attr_offset.description:
Description=If available, this field reports the actual Offset that was set for this Detector during the Acquisition of this Channel. Offset is an electronic baseline added to the output signal generated by the sensor to ensure that the resulting signal level always correspond to a positive number of counts. Offset defines the black level setting of the image and it should be adjusted so that the lowest signals are near the detection threshold. NOTE: Please note that most modern Cameras do not have the possibility of setting the Offset.
Tier=2

attr_offsetmode.description:
Description=This field describes the way in which the Voltage Offset of the Detector is reported. It typically is expressed as an Arbitrary-units number, a Scaled percent (-100 to 100), or a a Voltage.
Tier=3

attr_operatingtemperature.description:
Description=This field represents the effective temperature the sensor was kept at during the Acquisition of this image.
Tier=3

attr_pixelreadoutrate.description:
Description=This represents the effective Pixel Readout Rate used for the Acquisition of this Channel. This value is defined as the inverse of the time required to digitize a single pixel (also referred to as serial conversion time). Pixel readout rate can be considered similar to a baud rate as it depends on the bytes per second that can be read from the detector and written on disk. Readout rates are usually given in pixels/second (e.g., 500 kilopixels/second).
Tier=1

attr_sensorexposuremode.description:
Description=In case of a CMOS Camera and if selectable, this field reports the sensor Exposure modality used for the Acquisition of this Channel. In the Rolling Exposure mode adjacent rows of the array are exposed at slightly different times as the readout 'waves' sweep through each half of the sensor. In the Global Exposure mode (i.e., 'Snapshot' exposure mode) all pixels of the array are exposed simultaneously, thus enabling 'freeze frame' capture of fast moving or fast changing events. In this modality the CMOS Camera behaves like an interline CCD sensor.
Tier=1

CameraSettings.title: CameraSettings

Channel.description:
Extension=Core
Domain=ImageAcquisitionSettings
Category=Image
Description=Each Image has to have at least one Plane and one Channel. The Channel element stores information about how the each Image Channel was acquired. The total number of Channel elements for a given Image must equal to SizeC.
Tier=1

Description=Each Image has to have at least one Plane and one Channel. The Channel element stores information about how the each Image Channel was acquired. The total number of Channel elements for a given Image must equal to SizeC.

attr_color.description:
Description=This field records the Color used to render this Channel - encoded as RGBA. The default value is -1 corresponding #FFFFFFFF, so solid white (it is a signed 32 bit value).
Tier=1

attr_contrastmethod.description:
Description=This field describes the technique used to achieve contrast for this Channel.
Tier=1

attr_illuminationtype.description:
Description=This field describes the Light Microscopy Illumination method performed in this case. Allowable terms were obtained from the Biological Imaging Methods Ontology (Fbbi; https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/fbbi) Light Microscopy term (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FBbi_00000345).
Tier=1

attr_illuminationtypetermacession.description:
Description=This field records the Accession ID for the term used to describe the Illumination Type. A sub-classes of Light Microscopy term (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FBbi_00000345) is recommended.
Tier=1

attr_samplesperpixel.description:
Description=This field is prevalently used for RGB Images and records the number of samples the detector takes to form each pixel value. [units:none]
Tier=3

Channel.title: Channel

ChromaticRegistrationEvaluation.description:
Extension=Calibration and Performance
Domain=ImageAcquisitionSettings
Category=CalibrationProcedure
Description=According to ISO 21073:2019, co-registration accuracy measures the capacity of a microscope system to image a fluorescent object with different excitation and emission Wavelengths at the same position in the Image. Hence, the spatial distance of the Image positions of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) located in the centre of the Field of View (FOV) for different excitation and detection Wavelength bands is denoted as co-registration accuracy. The co-registration accuracy shall be calculated from the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of the Point-like object for the different Wavelengths. The lateral co-registration accuracy is expressed as: ∆lateral = √(xλ1 - xλ2)^2 + (yλ1 - yλ2)^2; and the axial co-registration accuracy is expressed as: ∆axial = √(zλ1 - zλ2)^2. This element refers to the results of a specific Co-registration Accuracy evaluation assay associated with this Optical Calibration procedure.
Tier=2
Extension=Calibration and Performance
Domain=ImageAcquisitionSettings
Category=CalibrationProcedure
Description=According to ISO 21073:2019, co-registration accuracy measures the capacity of a microscope system to image a fluorescent object with different excitation and emission Wavelengths at the same position in the Image. Hence, the spatial distance of the Image positions of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) located in the centre of the Field of View (FOV) for different excitation and detection Wavelength bands is denoted as co-registration accuracy. The co-registration accuracy shall be calculated from the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of the Point-like object for the different Wavelengths. The lateral co-registration accuracy is expressed as: ∆lateral = √(xλ1 - xλ2)^2 + (yλ1 - yλ2)^2; and the axial co-registration accuracy is expressed as: ∆axial = √(zλ1 - zλ2)^2. This element refers to the results of a specific Co-registration Accuracy evaluation assay associated with this Optical Calibration procedure.
Tier=2

attr_axialchromaticshift_rt.description:
Description=This field captures the offset in the the observed Z-coordinate of the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) when comparing the Reference vs. the Test Wavelengths. This shall be calculates as: √(zλT - zλR)^2, where This offset could be reported either in number of Pixels or in physical Distance, when a sub-Pixel offset needs to be calculated.
Tier=2

attr_axialchromaticshift_tr.description:
Description=This field captures the offset in the the observed Z-coordinate of the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) when comparing the Test vs. the Reference Wavelengths. This shall be calculates as: √(zλT - zλR)^2, where This offset could be reported either in number of Pixels or in physical Distance, when a sub-Pixel offset needs to be calculated.
Tier=2

attr_referencewavelength.description:
Description=This field captures the Wavelength of the Reference Channel against which the Chromatic Registration Accuracy is being calculated in this procedure.
Tier=2

attr_testwavelength.description:
Description=This field captures the Wavelength of the Test Channel whose Chromatic Registration Accuracy is being calculated in this procedure.
Tier=2

attr_xchromaticshift_rt.description:
Description=This field captures the offset in the the observed X-coordinate of the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) when comparing the Reference vs. the Test Wavelengths. This shall be calculates as: √(xλT - xλR)^2, where This offset could be reported either in number of Pixels or in physical Distance, when a sub-Pixel offset needs to be calculated.
Tier=2

attr_xchromaticshift_tr.description:
Description=This field captures the offset in the the observed X-coordinate of the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) when comparing the Test vs. the Reference Wavelengths. This shall be calculates as: √(xλR - xλT)^2, where This offset could be reported either in number of Pixels or in physical Distance, when a sub-Pixel offset needs to be calculated.
Tier=2

attr_ychromaticshift_rt.description:
Description=This field captures the offset in the the observed Y-coordinate of the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) when comparing the Reference vs. the Test Wavelengths. This shall be calculates as: √(xλT - xλR)^2, where This offset could be reported either in number of Pixels or in physical Distance, when a sub-Pixel offset needs to be calculated.
Tier=2

attr_ychromaticshift_tr.description:
Description=This field captures the offset in the the observed Y-coordinate of the Intensity maxima or the Intensity centre of gravity of the Image of a Point-like object (i.e., Spot or Point Emitter) when comparing the Test vs. the Reference Wavelengths. This shall be calculates as: √(xλR - xλT)^2, where This offset could be reported either in number of Pixels or in physical Distance, when a sub-Pixel offset needs to be calculated.

Condenser.description:
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=OpticalAssembly
Description=Condensers are Lens Systems located above the Light Source and under the sample in an Upright Microscope, and above the stage and below the Light Source in an Inverted Microscope. They act to gather light from the Light Source and concentrate it into a cone of light that illuminates the specimen. They typically include a Turret system and Diaphragms. The aperture and angle of the light cone must be adjusted (via the size of the Diaphragm) for each different Objective.
Tier=1
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=OpticalAssembly
Description=Condensers are Lens Systems located above the Light Source and under the sample in an Upright Microscope, and above the stage and below the Light Source in an Inverted Microscope. They act to gather light from the Light Source and concentrate it into a cone of light that illuminates the specimen. They typically include a Turret system and Diaphragms. The aperture and angle of the light cone must be adjusted (via the size of the Diaphragm) for each different Objective.
Tier=1

Condenser.title: Condenser

CondenserLens.description:
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Lens
Description=A Condenser Lens renders a divergent beam from a point source into a parallel or converging beam to illuminate an object. It acts to gather light from the Light Source and concentrate it into a cone of light that illuminates the specimen. The aperture and angle of the light cone must be adjusted (via the size of the diaphragm) for each different objective Lens with different numerical apertures. Conserser Lenses are typically housed within a specific component of the Microscope called the Condenser.
Tier=1
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Lens
Description=A Condenser Lens renders a divergent beam from a point source into a parallel or converging beam to illuminate an object. It acts to gather light from the Light Source and concentrate it into a cone of light that illuminates the specimen. The aperture and angle of the light cone must be adjusted (via the size of the diaphragm) for each different objective Lens with different numerical apertures. Conserser Lenses are typically housed within a specific component of the Microscope called the Condenser.
Tier=1

attr_abbenumber.description:
Description=This field records the Abbe number of this Lens. The Abbe Number is a measure of the material's dispersion (variation of Refractive Index versus Wavelength), with high values indicating low dispersion.
Tier=3

attr_attenuationcoefficient.description:
Description=This field records the Attenuation Coefficient (AC) of this optical element. The AC (aka blocking coefficient) is a material property that characterizes the degree to which light is being blocked (i.e., scattered or absorbed) by it. AC is used as a measure of the out-of-band blocking of an optical Lens, Filter, Dichroic mirror over an extended range of the spectrum. AC is often reported in units of optical density (OD), whereas OD= -log10(T), and T=Transmittance (0≤T≤1).
Tier=3

attr_backfocallength.description:
Description=This field records the distance (f') measured along the optical axis from the rear principal Plane of this Lens to the rear focal Plane (F').
Tier=3

attr_catalognumber.description:
Description=This field records the Catalog, Part or Serial Number used by the Manufacturer to uniquely identify this component.
Tier=1

attr_coating.description:
Description=This field reports a description for any Coating that was layered on the Cover Glass, either by the Manufacturer or after purchase (e.g., Poly-L-Lysine, Collagen).
Tier=1

attr_composite.description:
Description=This field records whether this Lens is Composite (i.e., composed of multiple Lenses; True) or Simple (False).
Tier=3

attr_density.description:
Description=This field records the Density of the material this Lens is made of.
Tier=3

attr_diameter.description:
Description=This field describes the Diameter of this optical element.
Tier=3

attr_frontfocallength.description:
Description=This field records the distance (f) measured along the optical axis from the front principal Plane of this Lens to the front focal Plane (F).
Tier=3

attr_geometry.description:
Description=This field records the geometrical shape of the surface(s) of this Mirror.
Tier=3

attr_glasscode.description:
Description=If available, this field records the international Glass Code of the material that constitutes this Mirror. The Glass Code designation is based on U.S. military standard MIL-G-174, and it consists of a six-digit number specifying the glass according to its Refractive Index nd at the Fraunhofer d- (or D3-) line, and its Abbe Number Vd also taken at that line. The resulting Glass Code is the value of nd-1 rounded to three digits, followed by Vd rounded to three digits, with all decimal points ignored. For example, BK7 has nd = 1.5168 and Vd = 64.17, giving a six-digit Glass Code of 517642.
Tier=3

attr_imagedistance.description:
Description=This field records the distance in air between the rear principal Plane of this Objective and the primary Image Plane.
Tier=3

attr_infinity.description:
Description=This field records whether (True) or not (False) this Lens is infinity corrected. An Infinity-corrected Lens is fixed for an infinite sample to primary Image distance. It needs to be used with a Tube Lens of appropriate focal length to obtain the specified magnification.
Tier=2

attr_lensna.description:
Description=This field captures the nominal Numerical Aperture (NA) of this Objective as specified by the Manufactuer, expressed as a floating-point (real) number (e.g. 1.27 NA). NA is a number that was defined initially by Abbe to characterize Objectives and Condensers. NA can be calculated by the expression n sin alpha, where n is the Refractive Index of the medium between the Lens and the Sample, and alpha is half the Angular Aperture of the Lens. NA is a measure of how much of the illumination that leaves the specimen actually passes through the Lens. The larger the NA, the more information the lens can transmit. Expected range 0.02 - 1.5.
Tier=1

attr_lotnumber.description:
Description=The Lot Number used by the Manufacturer to refer to a specific production batch or lot for this component.
Tier=3

attr_magnification.description:
Description=This field captures the Magnification of the Objective as specified by the Manufacturer - i.e., 60 represents a 60X lens.
Tier=1

attr_manufacturer.description:
Description=This field refers to the company, research group or individual who built or manufactured this hardware component.
Tier=1

attr_materialname.description:
Description=This field records the chemical composition or the non-proprietary trade designation of the material used to construct this Light Guide.
Tier=3

attr_model.description:
Description=This field refers to the Model name or any other designation the Manufacturer uses for this component.
Tier=1

attr_radiusofcurvature.description:
Description=The radius of curvature of this Mirror. A spherical lens or Mirror surface has a center of curvature located either along or decentered from the system local optical axis. The vertex of the lens surface is located on the local optical axis. The distance from the vertex to the center of curvature is the radius of curvature of the surface.
Tier=3

attr_refractiveindex.description:
Description=This field reocrds the nominal Refractive Index of this Immersion Liquid, as specified by the Manufacturer.
Tier=2

attr_shape.description:
Description=This field captures the Shape of the aperture of this Iris Diaphragm.
Tier=3

attr_workingdistance.description:
Description=This field reports the Working Distance of this Objective under normal operating conditions. The Working Distance is the distance (in air, or in the specified immersion liquid) between the front of an Objective and the surface of the cover glass or of the specimen if uncovered.
Tier=2

CondenserLens.title: CondenserLens

ConfocalScanner.description:
Description=According to ISO-10934-2-2007, a confocal microscope is a microscope in which, ideally, a point in the object plane is illuminated by a diffraction-limited spot of light, and light emanating from this point is focused upon and detected from an area smaller than the central area of the diffraction disc. The confocal principle leads to improved axial resolution by suppression of light from out-of-focus planes. In order to utilize this modality, a Confocal Scanner is used to form an Image of an extended Specimen region by controlling the direction of an outgoing Laser beam, the position of the Specimen or the location of the illuminated and detected spots simultaneously. Refer to https://www.iso.org/standard/69820.html for further details and measurement methods.
Description=According to ISO-10934-2-2007, a confocal microscope is a microscope in which, ideally, a point in the object plane is illuminated by a diffraction-limited spot of light, and light emanating from this point is focused upon and detected from an area smaller than the central area of the diffraction disc. The confocal principle leads to improved axial resolution by suppression of light from out-of-focus planes. In order to utilize this modality, a Confocal Scanner is used to form an Image of an extended Specimen region by controlling the direction of an outgoing Laser beam, the position of the Specimen or the location of the illuminated and detected spots simultaneously. Refer to https://www.iso.org/standard/69820.html for further details and measurement methods.
ConfocalScanner.title: ConfocalScanner

ConfocalScannerSettings.description:
Extension=Advanced+Confocal
Domain=ImageAcquisitionSettings
Category=Settings
Description=This element holds the Setting applied to a Confocal Scanner used during the Acquisiton of this Channel as well as a reference (the ID attribute) to the Confocal Scanner in question.
Tier=1
Extension=Advanced+Confocal
Domain=ImageAcquisitionSettings
Category=Settings
Description=This element holds the Setting applied to a Confocal Scanner used during the Acquisiton of this Channel as well as a reference (the ID attribute) to the Confocal Scanner in question.
Tier=1

attr__confocalfieldnumber.description:
Description=This field recors the Field Number of the Confocal scan optic is expressed as the objective magnification times the maximum diameter of the scanned field; [mm], obtained without shifting the position of the specimen and without stitching single images into a total larger image. Because images generally have a square format, the diameter of the scanned field is equals to the square root of 2 times the length of X dimension of the scanned field. Refer to https://www.iso.org/standard/69820.html for further details and measurement methods.
Tier=3

attr_descanned.description:
Description=This field indicates whether or not the Acquisition of this Image involved descanning.
Tier=1

attr_effectivezoom.description:
Description=This field describes the Effective Zoom factor that was utilized for the acquisition of this Image (e.g., zoom = 1.3). In confocal microscopy, it is possible to set a given hardware-based Zoom factor, aka "Confocal Zoom" or "Scan Zoom", by reducing the angle at which the scanning mirrors operate. As a result, the scanned area will be reduced in size, which (because the pixel areas associated with the scan are kept constant) will decrease the effective size of the portion of the sample that is projected on each pixel thus increasing the effective resolving power of the system. For example, with a 512x512 pixel area, and with a 40x objective, zoom 1 we result in a pixel size of 732nm, while zoom 10 will reduce the pixel size to 73nm).In confocal microscopy, it is possible to set a given hardware-based Zoom factor, aka "Confocal Zoom" or "Scan Zoom", by reducing the angle at which the scanning mirrors operate. As a result, the scanned area will be reduced in size, which (because the pixel areas associated with the scan are kept constant) will decrease the effective size of the portion of the sample that is projected on each pixel thus increasing the effective resolving power of the system. For example, with a 512x512 pixel area, and with a 40x objective, zoom 1 we result in a pixel size of 732nm, while zoom 10 will reduce the pixel size to 73nm).
Tier=1

attr_id.description:
Description=This is the Unique Identifier of the device used in this case.
Tier=1

attr_integrationmethod.description:
Description=Signal integration is generally utilized to improve the overall signal-to-noise ratio of the resulting Image. This field defines the signal Integration Method utilized for the Acquisition of this Channel.
Tier=1

attr_integrationnumber.description:
Description=Signal integration is generally utilized to improve the overall signal-to-noise ratio of the resulting Image. This field records the number of sequential Scanning Units (Line, Frame or Stack) that have been integrated for the Acquisition of this Channel.
Tier=1

attr_integrationunit.description:
Description=Signal integration is generally utilized to improve the overall signal-to-noise ratio of the resulting Image. This field refers to the nature of the Scanning Units used as the basis of signal integration. Refer to https://www.iso.org/standard/69820.html for further details and measurement methods.
Tier=1

attr_multichannelmode.description:
Description=This field defines whether the the the Aquisiton of Multiple Channels for this Image happened in a Parallel (i.e., multiple channels acquired at the same time), or Sequentail (i.e., one channel after the other) manner.
Tier=2

attr_pinholespacing.description:
Description=If applicable, this field records the Spacing between individual Pinholes that was set during the Acquisition of this Channel.
Tier=1

attr_pinholespacingunit.description:
Description=If applicable, this field records the Spacing between individual Pinholes that was set during the Acquisition of this Channel.
Tier=1

attr_presetpinholesize.description:
Description=In case this Confocal Scanner (i.e., Spinning disk, Swept-field, or other Multi-point scanners) has several fixed Pinhole Sizes to choose from, this field records the Pinhole Size that was set during the Acquisition of this Channel.
Tier=1

attr_rotation.description:
Description=This field records the Rotation angle of the scan region.
Tier=3

attr_scandirectionality.description:
Description=This field records the ScanDirectionality that was set for this device during Acquisition. In Unidirectional scan mode, data are only acquired while the laser beam moves in one direction. In Bidirectional scan mode, one line is scanned in one direction, and the next line in the opposite direction. In other words, the return run, or flyback, of the laser beam is used for recording data as well, thus increasing the scanning frequency when using bidirectional scan mode. Refer to https://www.iso.org/standard/69820.html for further details and measurement methods.
Tier=1

attr_scanformat.description:
Description=This field defines the format of the scanned element utilized for this Acquisition. Refer to https://www.iso.org/standard/69820.html for further details and measurement methods.
Tier=2

attr_scanningfrequency.description:
Description=This field records the Scanning Frequency is defined at the ratio between the Number of scanning element (Lines, Frames or Stacks) acquired and ScanTime. Refer to https://www.iso.org/standard/69820.html for further details and measurement methods.
Tier=3

attr_scantime.description:
Description=This records the time in seconds required to acquire a given number of lines, frames or stacks including the time required for repositioning the scanning device to the starting point. Refer to https://www.iso.org/standard/69820.html for further details and measurement methods.
Tier=2

attr_zoomareaheight.description:
Description=This field records the Height of the Zoom Area that was scanned during the Acquisition of this Channel, expressed in Pixels.
Tier=1

attr_zoomareawidth.description:
Description=This field records the Width of the Zoom Area that was scanned during the Acquisition of this Channel, expressed in Pixels.
Tier=1

ConfocalScannerSettings.title: ConfocalScannerSettings

CouplingLens.description:
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Lens
Description=This element refers to a Lens positioned at the mount connecting the Light Source Coupling device and the Microscope Stand.
Tier=2
Extension=Basic
Domain=MicroscopeHardwareSpecifications
Category=Lens
Description=This element refers to a Lens positioned at the mount connecting the Light Source Coupling device and the Microscope Stand.
